data.name: AboutDescription
data.value:
TQVault by bman654 (wickedsoul_@yahoo.com)
Contributors:
- EPinter: bug fixes, UI rework, new big vault, improvements - NorthFury: bug fixes, search features, improvements - Malgardian: Anniversary Edition port - Help on Item Stats by SadYc (sadyc1@gmail.com)
- Additional features by VillageIdiot (villij-idjit@sbcglobal.net)
- New User Interface by AvunaOs - German translation by FOE. - French translation by Jean and Vifarc. - Polish translation by Cygi. - Russian translation by Xelat. - Spanish translation by Kurrus.

data.name: ARZExtractCreateFolder
data.value: {0} does not exist. Would you like to create it now?

data.name: ARZExtractCreateFolderIT
data.value: {0} does not exist for IT database. Would you like to create it now?

data.name: ARZExtractDestination
data.value: Select the destination folder for the extracted database records

data.name: ARZExtractFileDest
data.value: You must specify a folder, not a file!

data.name: ARZExtractLabel1
data.value: Currently there is no way to extract all of the game database records at once. Also there currently exists a bug in the Toolset that destroys array values when you extract records one by one. Using this tool, you can now extract all records at once and all the records will be extracted correctly.

data.name: ARZExtractLabel2
data.value: After you have extracted the records, just copy the ones you want to use in your mod over to your mod folder.

data.name: ARZExtractLabel4
data.value: Choose a destination folder for IT Database Files:

data.name: ARZExtractLabel5
data.value: If not populated the destination folders for the TQ database and the IT database will default to the same folder. The IT files will overwrite the TQ files when there are conflicts though you can select different folders to avoid overwriting files.

data.name: ARZExtractValidDest
data.value: You must enter a valid destination folder.

data.name: CmdlineUsage

The Vault Path was not set.
Using the default setting. Please verify the Vault Path with the configuration dialog.

data.value: Please update the vault path in the configuration to reflect the link.

data.name: Form1BadLanguage
data.value: This may be caused by a bad language or game path setting. Would you like to restart TQVault?

data.name: Form1Label3
data.value: A magical place where you can store your artifacts of power that you will need to save the world from the Titans.

data.name: GlobalMenuBag
data.comment: This entry must have the GlobalMenuBagDelimiter or it will break the item and bag move code.

data.name: GlobalMenuBagDelimiter
data.comment: Used with GlobalMenuBag to signify bag number in menus.

data.value: You are currently holding an item. Please place the item down somewhere before quitting.

The Game Language Setting has been changed.
You will need to restart TQVault for it take effect. Would you like to restart TQVault now?

The Custom Maps setting has been changed.
You will need to restart TQVault for it take effect. Would you like to restart TQVault now?

data.name: MainFormReadError

The Game Settings have been changed.
You will need to restart TQVault for it take effect. Would you like to restart TQVault now?

data.name: MainFormStartVaultMon
data.value: Would you like to start TQVaultMon?

data.name: MainFormStartVaultMonMsg
data.value:
You have just modified the inventory of some of your characters. Titan Quest will detect this and think that your character is corrupt and will not let you load your character.
TQVaultMon is a program that, when running, will make Titan Quest think that your character is okay and will let you load it successfully. Once you have successfully loaded your character you will not need to use TQVaultMon again unless you make further edits.
It is suggested that you start TQVaultMon now and then run Titan Quest and briefly load all of the characters you have just modified.
Would you like to start TQVaultMon now?

data.name: MainFormTrashItems
data.value:
There are currently {0} items in the trash. If you quit these items will be LOST FOREVER.
Are you sure you wish to throw away these items?

data.name: MainFormVaultMonMsg
data.value:
I was unable to see if TQVaultMon was running. Most likely TQVaultMon will not work either. Because you have modified some of your characters, TQ will think your characters are corrupt. In order to successfully load the game and play, you will need to download TQ Defiler and use its 'Patch' or 'Fix Me' options to let the game validate your character. If you do not mind, please contact me and let me know about this problem because I may have a solution to the error that will save you some hassles.
Error message follows

data.value: There was an error during sorting. Not all items have been placed.

data.name: SackPanelAutoSortMsg
data.value: You are currently holding an item. Please place the item down somewhere before sorting.

data.name: SackPanelDeleteMsg
data.value: This item will be PERMANENTLY DELETED! Are you sure you want to delete this item?

data.name: SackPanelDeleteMultiMsg
data.value: Are you sure you want to PERMANENTLY DELETE the selected items?

data.name: SackPanelRemoveRelicMsg
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove the relic from this item?

data.name: SeedLabel1
data.value:
Titan Quest uses the Item Seed to randomize the stats of your items so that no two items look exactly alike. It is unknown exactly how the seed affects your item stats. Changing the seed will cause some slight change in the stats of your item the next time you play the game.
Pick a number between 1 and 32767

data.name: SeedRange
data.value: Item Seed must be a valid integer between 1 and 32767

data.name: SettingsAllowCopyTT
data.value: Enables copy selection in the context menu.

data.name: SettingsAllowEditTT
data.value: Turns on the editing features in the context menu. These include item creation and modification.

data.name: SettingsAutoUpdateTT
data.value: Selecting this item will automatically check for new versions of TQVault on the web when the program starts up. May cause startup to take longer if the network connection is slow.

data.name: SettingsBrowseIT
data.value: Please select the path for the Immortal Throne game files.

data.name: SettingsBrowseTQ
data.value: Please select the path for the Titan Quest game files.

data.name: SettingsBrowseVault
data.value: Please select the path for TQVault Vault files.

data.name: SettingsEnableModTT
data.value: Selecting this item will enable the drop down to select custom maps.

data.name: SettingsForceCheckTT
data.value: Manually checks if there are any updates available.

data.name: SettingsLoadChar
data.value: Automatically Load the last opened Character

data.name: SettingsLoadCharTT
data.value: Selecting this option will automatically load the last open character when TQVault was closed.

data.name: SettingsLoadVault
data.value: Automatically Load the last opened Vault

data.name: SettingsLoadVaultTT
data.value: Selecting this item will automatically load the last opened vault when TQVault was closed. TQVault will automatically open Main Vault if nothing is chosen.

data.name: SettingsNoWarningTT
data.value: When enabled, confirmation messages will no longer be shown for item deletion and relic removal or if there are items in the trash when TQVault is closed.

data.name: SettingsPreLoad
data.value: Pre-Load All Vault And Character Files

data.name: SettingsPreLoadTT
data.value: Selecting this item will automatically load all of the available character, stash and vault files on startup. This aids the search function, but increases startup time.

data.name: SettingsResetTT
data.value: Causes the configuration to Reset to the last saved configuration.

data.name: SettingsSkipTitleTT
data.value: Ticking this box will automatically hit the Enter key on the title screen.

data.name: StashNotFoundMsg
data.value: The Stash file cannot be found. Please visit the Caravan Trader in game to create the file. The Storage Area tab will be unavailable for this character.

data.name: UpdateErrorMsg
data.value: There was a problem with the download or the extraction. Please download the latest full setup install package and run it manually. Click OK to exit.

data.name: UpdateFullInstall
data.value: A newer version of TQVault has been found which requires a full installation.

data.name: UpdateNewTQVault
data.value: A newer version of TQVault has been found.

data.name: UpdateNewUpdater
data.value: A newer version of the TQVault update program has been found.

data.name: UpdateNoUpdate
data.value: Your version is up to date.

data.name: UpdatePerform
data.value: Click OK to perform an update.

data.name: UpdatePerformBoth
data.value: Click OK to perform both updates.

data.name: UpdateRunInstall
data.value: Click OK to download and run the installer.

data.name: UpdateStreamError
data.value: There was an error connecting to the update server. An update cannot be performed.

data.name: UpdateUpdaterNotFound
data.value: The TQVault update program was either not found or the name has changed.

data.name: AUEnglishName
data.comment: Do not Translate. Used for AutoUpdate. Used to determine which language file to update.

data.name: AUFileVersion
data.comment: Do not Translate. Used for AutoUpdate. Used to track changes in the translation file.

data.name: AUMinTQVaultVersion
data.comment: Do not Translate. Used for AutoUpdate. Change this value to match program version when new keys are added. Will trigger an update on next restart.

data.name: SearchDialogText
data.value:
Search for items within the loaded files: vaults, stashes, inventories.
You can combine the following search options(all are optional): * Name: It must be the first search term. Here is an example: 'arctic & of frost' * Type: by using @ at the beginning of the search term for example '@sword' * Attributes: by using # at the beginning of the search term for example '#elemental resistance' * Rarity: by using $ at the beginning of the search term for example '$rare' You can use | in a term as an OR condition. '$common | rare' returns all common and all rare items.
Here is a complex example: 'arctic & of frost @ring $rare | common'

data.name: SettingsPlayerReadonlyTT
data.value: Avoid save game corruption that occurs randomly. When enabled, player equipment will be read-only, you won't be able to select or move any item.

data.name: AlbertusMTLight

data.name: SettingEnableDetailedTooltipViewTT
data.value: Split tooltip attributes into Prefix/Base/Suffix categories

data.name: SettingsEnableItemRequirementRestrictionTT
data.value: When enabled, a red background color is displayed on items where the selected character does not meet the item requirements. The character will also not be able to equip items where the requirements are not met.

data.name: SearchOperatorDescOr
data.value: Find items having one filter or more

data.name: SearchTooManyResultToDisplay
data.value: There is too many results to display.{^N}Adjust your search.

data.name: SearchQueryNameAlreadyExist
data.value: Query name already exists. Do you want to override it ?

data.name: GlobalDeleteConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}" ?

data.name: SettingsEnableHotReloadTT
data.value: All "in game" update of a monitored save file (Player, Stash, Transfer Stash, Relic Stash) are visible in real time in TQVaultAE. In case you have unsaved changes in TQVaultAE, the "in game" saving system prevail and override your changes. You still have to close TQVaultAE to apply your changes.
